intro: Pelargonium affine, commonly known as the African geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features upright stems with opposite, palmately lobed leaves that are usually hairy and have a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, Pelargonium affine is widely cultivated in gardens around the world.
